definition: to sigh with sorrow, regret etc/rueful/deeply moved
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
old variant of 慨[kai3]/to sigh (with emotion)

sentences.english: Such sigh absolutly come from no excuse. such as suddenly thought of life and death.
sentences.chinese: 若干感慨，简直无来由，比如忽然想到生死。

sentences.english: Winds flying through the fingers, I sigh deeply at my old image in the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 风从指间掠过，我对镜中的自己感慨良久。

sentences.english: Beautiful feeling, for whom the load.
The horse was Liangzi behavior is female with emotion.
sentences.chinese: 马母被梁子的行为更是感慨万分。

sentences.english: The old people trade the year to live in the past difficult and the sigh with emotion present happy life.
sentences.chinese: 老人们换年过去生活的艰辛和感慨现在的幸福生活。

sentences.english: Wear old speak about oneself to break to translate antecedents, the regrets is very many.
sentences.chinese: 戴老谈及自己破译经历，感慨良多。

sentences.english: A life, he will have to express some emotion.
sentences.chinese: 人生在世，总得发表一些感慨。

sentences.english: We gazed up at the cloudless blue sky, marvelling in …
sentences.chinese: 望蓝天，万里无云，恢宏的美景让我们感慨万千。

sentences.english: Why younger guy near when going on phone exclamation butterfly pretty?
sentences.chinese: 为什么年老小伙临去时在电话中感慨蝴蝶美丽？

sentences.english: Walking in the new century journey, I filled with a thousand regrets.
sentences.chinese: 走在新世纪的征途上，我感慨万千。

sentences.english: When she saw the great changes of her home town, all sorts of feelings welled in her mind.
sentences.chinese: 当她看到了家乡的巨大变化，真是感慨万端。

sentences.english: Back after the storm of these, filled with emotion, a long way to go.
sentences.chinese: 回想起这些后的风雨，感慨万千，路还很长。

sentences.english: Today is the last day of selling newspaper, feeling is quite deep in heart.
sentences.chinese: 今天是卖报最后一天，心中感慨颇深。

sentences.english: Because every time it rains, I fall to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 每一次落雨，我心中总是无限感慨。

sentences.english: Anyway, it's really a sweety day.

definition: to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to mock oneself/to laugh at oneself
to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
